alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Genesee; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 4:34AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CHAUTAUQUA... CATTARAUGUS...SOUTHERN ERIE...WYOMING...GENESEE...AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 432 AM EST, a lake effect snow band was centered across the Lake Erie shoreline in Chautauqua county and southern Erie county. The band will meander slightly north through 6 a.m. with it`s northern fringe moving across more of downtown Buffalo, Williamsville, and Clarence. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Lackawanna, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Dunkirk, Fredonia, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Evans, Elma, Boston, Eden and Marilla. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 60. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. The snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. &&

area.areaDesc: Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Genesee; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming
